title: [BUG] Decimal Division Mismatch On Some Versions Of Spark
body:
**Describe the bug**
When `resultDecimalType` was introduced in Spark 3.4.0+ and Databricks 330+, we started doing the right thing when dividing DecimalTypes while Spark still gave the wrong results according to the [bug](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-45786) 

**Steps/Code to reproduce bug**

```
scala> val df = Seq(("-0.172787979", "533704665545018957788294905796.5"), ("1", "2")).toDF("_1", "_2")
scala> df.repartition(3).selectExpr("cast(_1 as decimal(9,9)) / cast(_2 as decimal(31,1))").show(false)
+------------------------------------------------------+
|(CAST(_1 AS DECIMAL(9,9)) / CAST(_2 AS DECIMAL(31,1)))|
+------------------------------------------------------+
|-0.0000000000000000000000000000003237520              |
|NULL                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------+

scala> spark.conf.set("spark.rapids.sql.enabled", false)

scala> df.repartition(3).selectExpr("cast(_1 as decimal(9,9)) / cast(_2 as decimal(31,1))").show(false) 
+------------------------------------------------------+
|(CAST(_1 AS DECIMAL(9,9)) / CAST(_2 AS DECIMAL(31,1)))|
+------------------------------------------------------+
|-0.0000000000000000000000000000003237521              |
|NULL                                                  |
+------------------------------------------------------+
```

**Expected behavior**
We should match Spark bug for bug for versions of Databricks 330+ and Spark 340+

**Additional context**
The original [bug](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids/issues/9859) was created as part of the audit process. In resolving that as part of the spark-rapids-jni [PR](https://github.com/NVIDIA/spark-rapids-jni/pull/1623), it was discovered that the division got broken on Spark versions listed above after the release of Spark 330db.
